The html elementroot element

Categories This Contentan zone document Element Belongs

None I refer to the html element as being in a Zero Category Contentan zone document Previous Location!

how this element is used Contentan zone document
As the root element of a document
Wherever a subdocument fragment is allowed in a compound document
Element Content Model Contentan zone document
A head element followed by a body element
Attributes Allowed On This Element Contentan zone document
Attribute Description
Global Attributestags & attributesan zone document Common to and may be specified on any and all HyperText Markup LanguageRefers to the language itself not any particular version elements

Authors are encouraged to specify a langtags & attributesan zone document attribute on the root html element giving the documents languageThis aids speech synthesis tools to determine what pronunciations to use translation tools to determine what rules to use and so forth
Tag Omission in text/html Contentan zone document
An html elements start tagtags & attributesan zone document can be omitted if the first thing inside the html element is not a commentdelimiter descriptionan zone document
An html elements end tagtags & attributesan zone document can be omitted if the html element is not immediately followed by a commentdelimiter descriptionan zone document
Allowed Contentan zone documentARIA role Attribute Values
This element has no role attribute
Allowed ARIA Contentan zone documentState and Property Attributes
Global aria–* Attributes Contentan zone document
The Interface Specifications on theDocument Object Model This Element Must Implement

The head elementdocument metadata container

Categories This Contentan zone document Element Belongs

None I refer to the head element as being in a Zero Category Contentan zone document Previous Location!

how this element is used Contentan zone document
As the first element in an html element
Element Content Model Contentan zone document

If the document is an iframe srcdoc documentw3c Specifications or if title information is available from a higherlevel protocol: Zero or more elements of Metadata Content Contentan zone document of which no more than one is a title element and no more than one is a base element Otherwise: One or more elements of Metadata Content of which exactly one is a title element and no more than one is a base element Previous Location!

Attributes Allowed On This Element Contentan zone document
Attribute Description
Global Attributestags & attributesan zone document Common to and may be specified on any and all HyperText Markup LanguageRefers to the language itself not any particular version elements
Tag Omission in text/html Contentan zone document
A head elements start tagtags & attributesan zone document may be omitted if the element is empty or if the first thing inside the head element is an element
A head elements end tagtags & attributesan zone document may be omitted if the head element is not immediately followed by a space character or a commentdelimiter descriptionan zone document
Allowed Contentan zone documentARIA role Attribute Values
This element has no role values
Allowed ARIA Contentan zone documentState and Property Attributes
Global aria–* Attributes Contentan zone document
The Interface Specifications on theDocument Object Model This Element Must Implement

If the itemproptags & attributes zone document attribute is present: where Metadata Content is expected
If the itemproptags & attributes zone document attribute is present: where Phrasing Content is expected.

Where Metadata Content is expected
In a noscript element that is a child of a head element

Element Content Model Contentan zone document
EmptyThis is a “Void” Element Contentan zone document
Attributes Allowed On This Element Contentan zone document
Attribute Description
Global Attributestags & attributesan zone document Common to and may be specified on any and all HyperText Markup LanguageRefers to the language itself not any particular version elements
hreftags & attributesan zone document Address of the hyperlink
crossorigintags & attributesan zone document How the element handles crossorigin requests
reltags & attributesan zone document Relationship between the document containing the hyperlink and the destination resource
mediatags & attributesan zone document Applicable media
hreflangtags & attributesan zone document Language of the linked resource
typetags & attributesan zone document Hint for the type of the referenced resource
sizestags & attributesan zone document Sizes of the icons for (relicon)

The Global Attribute titletags & attributesan zone document has special semantics on this element: Title of the link; alternative style sheet set name

Tag Omission in text/html Contentan zone document
Void Element ContentAn Zone DocumentIt Has No End Tag

link Default – do not set

BearZ

In the majority of cases authors need not set the aria Default role or attribute propertiesIt is unnecessary and not recommendedThese properties are already set by the browser

The following are the event handler content attributes exposed on the body element
onafterprinttags & attributesan zone document onbeforeprinttags & attributesan zone document onbeforeunloadtags & attributesan zone document
onhashchangetags & attributesan zone document onlanguagechangetags & attributesan zone document onmessagetags & attributesan zone document
onofflinetags & attributesan zone document ononlinetags & attributesan zone document onpagehidetags & attributesan zone document
onpageshowtags & attributesan zone document onpopstatetags & attributesan zone document
onstoragetags & attributesan zone document onunloadtags & attributesan zone document
Tag Omission in text/html Contentan zone document
A body elements start tagtags & attributesan zone document may be omitted if the element is empty or if the first thing inside the body element is not a space character or a commentdelimiter descriptionan zone document except if the first thing inside the body element is a meta link script style or template element
A body elements end tagtags & attributesan zone document may be omitted if the body element is not immediately followed by a commentdelimiter descriptionan zone document
Allowed Contentan zone documentARIA role Attribute Values
documenttags & attributesan zone document role Default – do not set
applicationtags & attributesan zone document

download Whether to download the resource instead of navigating to it and its file name if so
ping Terminologyan zone documents to ping
rel Relationship between the document containing the hyperlink and the destination resource
hreflang Language of the linked resource
type Hint for the type of the referenced resource

The ruby elementruby annotation 

Categories This Contentan zone document Element Belongs
Flow Content Contentan zone document
Phrasing Content Contentan zone document
Palpable Content Contentan zone document
how this element is used Contentan zone document
Where Phrasing Content is expected
Element Content Model Contentan zone document
  • The Content Model of ruby elements consists of one or more of the following sequences:
  • One or the other of the following:
  • Phrasing Content but with no ruby elements and with no ruby element descendants.
  • A single ruby element that itself has no ruby element descendants.
  • One or the other of the following:
  • One or more rt elements.
  • An rp element followed by one or more rt elements each of which is itself followed by an rp element.
